instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has no power and no light on charger. No liquid damage. <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL>  is 18V but <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL> IS 0V

Have no shorts and already replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> with no luck.

What to check next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Any voltage out of <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> on pin 1? Something that very commonly happens on these newer Airs is that <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> fails and prevents voltage from passing through <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>. I'd replace it first

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Replaced <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> but still 0 voltage on pin 1 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/11 ok? There's not much else here that can cause that unless <SIGNAL>DCIN_ISOL</SIGNAL> is shorted. Another thing that can happen is broken trace between <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> and <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>. Also bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> is possible.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
You should get aprox 7V on <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> Gate.
Check <RESISTOR>R7010</RESISTOR>/11 and be sure <DIODE>D7012</DIODE> is correctly soldered.
